Coriolis

Coriolis¶

This is a reference for the Coriolis API.

Diagnostics¶

Gets diagnostic info about the Coriolis appliance.

GET
/diagnostics

List Diagnostics

Lists diagnostic data from all Coriolis services.

Normal response codes: 200

Error response codes: unauthorized(401), forbidden(403)

Response¶

Name

In

Type

Description

diagnostics

body

array

Array of diagnostics objects.

application

body

string

Name of the Coriolis service.

os_info

body

array

The Coriolis appliance’s host OS information.

hostname

body

string

The hostname of the Coriolis service container.

ip_addresses

body

object

IP addresses of all the interfaces attached to the Coriolis appliance.

licensing_status

body

object

The licensing status of the Coriolis appliance.

packages

body

array

The list of PIP packages installed on the Coriolis service container.

licences

body

object

The list of licenses installed on the Coriolis appliance.

reservations (Optional)

body

object

The list of reservations made by the Coriolis appliance.

Example of a Diagnostics List

{
    "diagnostics": [
        {
            "application": "coriolis-conductor",
            "packages": [
                "alembic==1.5.2",
                "amqp==5.0.5",
                "argparse==1.4.0",
                // ...
            ],
            "os_info": [
                "NAME=\"Ubuntu\"",
                "VERSION=\"18.04.5 LTS (Bionic Beaver)\"",
                "ID=ubuntu",
                "ID_LIKE=debian",
                "PRETTY_NAME=\"Ubuntu 18.04.5 LTS\"",
                "VERSION_ID=\"18.04\"",
                "HOME_URL=\"https://www.ubuntu.com/\"",
                "SUPPORT_URL=\"https://help.ubuntu.com/\"",
                "BUG_REPORT_URL=\"https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/\"",
                "PRIVACY_POLICY_URL=\"https://www.ubuntu.com/legal/terms-and-policies/privacy-policy\"",
                "VERSION_CODENAME=bionic",
                "UBUNTU_CODENAME=bionic",
                ""
            ],
            "hostname": "coriolis-conductor",
            "ip_addresses": [
                {
                    "eth0": {
                        "ipv4": [
                            {
                                "addr": "10.107.9.8",

Endpoints¶

Lists, creates, updates, shows details for, and deletes cloud endpoints.

GET
/endpoints

List Endpoints

Lists all endpoints.

Normal response codes: 200

Error response codes: unauthorized(401), forbidden(403)

Response¶

Name

In

Type

Description

endpoints

body

array

Array of endpoint objects.

created_at

body

string

ISO 8601 formatted date of endpoint creation.

updated_at

body

string

ISO 8601 formatted date of when the endpoint was last updated.

deleted_at

body

string

ISO 8601 formatted date of endpoint deletion.

deleted

body

integer

Integer representing whether endpoint is deleted or not. (0 or 1)

id

body

uuid

The id of a cloud endpoint.

user_id

body

uuid

Coriolis supports multiple users, this is the respective user’s id.

project_id

body

uuid

Coriolis supports multiple projects, this is the respective project’s id.

connection_info

body

object

A JSON encoded or a barbican secret ref containing password, username and other cloud-specific information for connection to an endpoint.

type

body

string

The type of cloud service platform.

name

body

string

The name of the endpoint.

description

body

string

The description of the endpoint.

mapped_regions

body

array

List containing the Coriolis regions this endpoint is available to.

Example of Endpoint List Response

{
  "endpoints": [
    {
      "created_at": "2019-07-10T12:10:55.000000",
      "updated_at": null,
      "deleted_at": null,

        "password": "Passw0rd",
        "allow_untrusted_swift": true,
        "project_domain_id": "default"
      },
      "type": "openstack",
      "name": "Endpoint Name Example",
      "description": "Example Endpoint Description",
      "mapped_regions": [
        "public"
      ]
    },
    {
      "created_at": "2019-07-09T07:04:13.000000",
      "updated_at": "2019-07-09T07:05:19.000000",

GET
/endpoints/{endpoint_id}

Show Endpoint

Shows details about an endpoint.

Preconditions

The endpoint must exist

Normal response codes: 200

Error response codes: unauthorized(401), forbidden(403), itemNotFound(404)

Request¶

Name

In

Type

Description

endpoint_id

path

uuid

The id of the endpoint.

Response¶

Name

In

Type

Description

endpoint

body

object

An endpoint object containing name, id, type, and connection information.

created_at

body

string

ISO 8601 formatted date of endpoint creation.

updated_at

body

string

ISO 8601 formatted date of when the endpoint was last updated.

deleted_at

body

string

ISO 8601 formatted date of endpoint deletion.

deleted

body

integer

Integer representing whether endpoint is deleted or not. (0 or 1)

id

body

uuid

The id of a cloud endpoint.

user_id

body

uuid

Coriolis supports multiple users, this is the respective user’s id.

project_id

body

uuid

Coriolis supports multiple projects, this is the respective project’s id.

connection_info

body

object

A JSON encoded or a barbican secret ref containing password, username and other cloud-specific information for connection to an endpoint.

type

body

uuid

The id of a cloud endpoint.

name

body

string

ISO 8601 formatted date of endpoint creation.

description

body

string

The description of the endpoint.

mapped_regions

body

array

List containing the Coriolis regions this endpoint is available to.
Example of Endpoint Show Response

    "connection_info": {
      "username": "admin",

      "allow_untrusted": true,

      "nova_region_name": "RegionOne",

If the endpoint was created using the Web-UI, the connection_info property will be saved as a Barbican Secret, which will be returned like in the example below

    },
    "type": "openstack",
    "name": "devstack",
    "description": null,
    "mapped_regions": [
      "public"
    ]
  }
}
POST
/endpoints

Create Endpoint

Creates a cloud endpoint.

Normal response codes: 200

Error response codes: unauthorized(401), forbidden(403)

Request¶

Name

In

Type

Description

connection_info

body

object

A JSON encoded or a barbican secret ref containing password, username and other cloud-specific information for connection to an endpoint.

type

body

array

The type of cloud service provider.

name

body

string

The name of the endpoint.

description

body

string

The description of the endpoint.

mapped_regions

body

array

List containing the Coriolis regions this endpoint is available to.

Example of Endpoint Create Request

{
  "endpoint": {
    "connection_info": {
      "username": "admin",
      "project_name": "admin",
      "user_domain_id": "default",
      "allow_untrusted": true,
      "identity_api_version": 3,
      "glance_api_version": 2,
      "auth_url": "http://25.48.0.101/identity/v3",
      "password": "Passw0rd",
      "allow_untrusted_swift": true,
      "project_domain_id": "default",
      "region_name": "RegionOne",
      "nova_region_name": "RegionOne",
      "neutron_region_name": "RegionOne",
      "glance_region_name": "RegionOne",
      "cinder_region_name": "RegionOne",
      "swift_region_name": "RegionOne",
      "interface_name": "publicURL",
      "nova_interface_name": "publicURL",
      "neutron_interface_name": "publicURL",
      "glance_interface_name": "publicURL",
      "cinder_interface_name": "publicURL",
      "swift_interface_name": "publicURL",
      "ceph_options": {
        "ceph_conf_file": [
          "[global]",
          "uth_supported = cephx",
          "keyring = /etc/ceph/$cluster.$name.keyring",
          "mon host = 10.107.3.219 10.107.3.222 10.107.3.239",
          "log to syslog = false",
          "err to syslog = false",
          "clog to syslog = false",
          "[client]"
        ],
        "ceph_username": "cinder-ceph",
        "ceph_keyring_file": [
          "[client.cinder-ceph]",
          "key = AQCXsL9f7UCQBhAAqiKtO+BrngtjkqfjzyJyfg=="
        ],
        "ceph_pool_name": "cinder-ceph",
        "ceph_cluster_name": "cinder-ceph",
        "ceph_connection_timeout": 0
      }
    },
    "type": "openstack",
    "name": "Endpoint Name Example",
    "description": "Example Endpoint Description",
    "mapped_regions": [
      "public"
    ]
  }
}

Response¶

Name

In

Type

Description

endpoint

body

object

An endpoint object containing name, id, type, and connection information.

name

body

string

ISO 8601 formatted date of endpoint creation.

description

body

string

The description of the endpoint.

id

body

uuid

The id of a cloud endpoint.

connection_info

body

object

A JSON encoded or a barbican secret ref containing password, username and other cloud-specific information for connection to an endpoint.

deleted

body

integer

Integer representing whether endpoint is deleted or not. (0 or 1)

deleted_at

body

string

ISO 8601 formatted date of endpoint deletion.

created_at

body

string

ISO 8601 formatted date of endpoint creation.

updated_at

body

string

ISO 8601 formatted date of when the endpoint was last updated.

type

body

string

The type of cloud service platform.

user_id

body

uuid

Coriolis supports multiple users, this is the respective user’s id.

project_id

body

uuid

Coriolis supports multiple projects, this is the respective project’s id.

mapped_regions

body

array

List containing the Coriolis regions this endpoint is available to.

PUT
/endpoints/{endpoint_id}

Update Endpoint

Preconditions

The endpoint must exist.

Updates an already existing endpoint, modifying its name, description or connection info.

Error response codes: unauthorized(401), forbidden(403), itemNotFound(404)

Request¶

Name

In

Type

Description

endpoint

body

object

An endpoint object containing name, id, type, and connection information.

endpoint_id

path

uuid

The id of the endpoint.

name

body

string

The name of the endpoint.

description

body

string

The description of the endpoint.

connection_info

body

object

A JSON encoded or a barbican secret ref containing password, username and other cloud-specific information for connection to an endpoint.

mapped_regions

body

array

List containing the Coriolis regions this endpoint is available to.

Example of Endpoint Update Request

{
  "endpoint": {
    "connection_info": {
      "cinder_interface_name": "publicURL",
      "swift_interface_name": "publicURL",
      "auth_url": "http://25.48.0.101/identity/v3",
      "nova_interface_name": "publicURL",
      "glance_region_name": "RegionOne",
      "neutron_region_name": "RegionOne",
      "cinder_region_name": "RegionOne",
      "glance_api_version": 2,
      "glance_interface_name": "publicURL",
      "interface_name": "publicURL",
      "allow_untrusted_swift": true,
      "username": "coriolis",
      "project_name": "coriolis",
      "project_domain_id": "default",
      "region_name": "RegionOne",
      "swift_region_name": "RegionOne",
      "nova_region_name": "RegionOne",
      "password": "Passw0rd",
      "user_domain_id": "default",
      "allow_untrusted": false,
      "identity_api_version": 3,
      "neutron_interface_name": "publicURL",
      "ceph_options": {
        "ceph_conf_file": [
          "[global]",
          "uth_supported = cephx",
          "keyring = /etc/ceph/$cluster.$name.keyring",
          "mon host = 10.107.3.219 10.107.3.222 10.107.3.239",
          "log to syslog = false",
          "err to syslog = false",
          "clog to syslog = false",
          "[client]"
        ],
        "ceph_username": "cinder-ceph",
        "ceph_keyring_file": [
          "[client.cinder-ceph]",
          "key = AQCXsL9f7UCQBhAAqiKtO+BrngtjkqfjzyJyfg=="
        ],
        "ceph_pool_name": "cinder-ceph",
        "ceph_cluster_name": "cinder-ceph",
        "ceph_connection_timeout": 0
      }
    },
    "name": "Updated Name",
    "description": "Updated description",
    "mapped_regions": [
      "public"
    ]
  }
}

DELETE
/endpoints/{endpoint_id}

Delete Endpoint

Deletes an endpoint.

Preconditions

The endpoint must exist.

Normal response codes: 204

Error response codes: itemNotFound(404),unauthorized(401), forbidden(403)

Request¶

Name

In

Type

Description

endpoint_id

path

uuid

The id of the endpoint.

Response¶

There is no response body for a successful deletion of an endpoint.

GET
/endpoints/{endpoint_id}/instances

Get Endpoint Instances

Lists the instances of an endpoint.

Preconditions

The endpoint must exist and the platform must support listing instances.

Normal response codes: 200

Error response codes: unauthorized(401), forbidden(403), itemNotFound(404)

Request¶

Name

In

Type

Description

endpoint_id

path

uuid

The id of the endpoint.

Response¶

Name

In

Type

Description

instances

body

array

Array of instance objects

limit (Optional)

query

integer

Returns a number of items up to a limit value.

name

body

string

The unique identifier of a virtual machine.

num_cpu

body

string

The numbers of CPUs of an instance.

num_cores_per_socket (Optional)

body

integer

Number of cores per socket used by the instance.

nested_virtualization (Optional)

body

boolean

Whether the instance is run on a nested virtualization environment.

memory_mb

body

integer

The memory of the instance in MB.

id

body

uuid

The id of the instance.

os_type

body

string

The OS type of an instance.

flavor_name

body

string

Name or ID of the flavor used by the instance.

firmware_type (Optional)

body

string

The type of firmware of the VM.

secure_boot (Optional)

body

boolean

Whether the machine has UEFI Secure Boot enabled or not.
Example Instance List on Openstack Endpoint

  "instances": [
    {

Shows details for a specific instance for an endpoint.

The returned instance information will mandatorily contain the below-listed response fields for all Coriolis Provider Plugins, while allowing for the plugins to expose extra fields at will.

Error response codes: unauthorized(401), forbidden(403), itemNotFound(404)

In

Type

Description

The id of the endpoint.

Type

Description

id

Endpoint Actions¶

POST
/endpoints/{endpoint_id}/actions

Validate Endpoint Connection

Validates connection to endpoint.

Preconditions

The endpoint must exist.

Normal response codes: 200

Error response codes: unauthorized(401), forbidden(403), itemNotFound(404)

Request¶

Name

In

Type

Description

validate_connection

body

object

An object that contains the validate connection action for the endpoint connection.

endpoint_id

path

uuid

The id of the endpoint.
Example of Endpoint Validate Connection Request
{
  "validate-connection": null
}

Response¶

Name

In

Type

Description

validate_connection

body

object

An object that contains the validate connection action for the endpoint connection.

valid

body

boolean

A boolean value representing whether the endpoint connection is valid.

message

body

string

The error message in case of endpoint validation failure.
Example of Endpoint Validate Connection Response
{
  "validate-connection": {
    "valid": true,
    "message": null
  }
}

Note

In case the endpoint validation fails, an error message will be returned, as in the example below

Example of Failed Endpoint Validation Response
{
  "validate-connection": {
    "valid": false,
    "message": "Unable to establish connection to http://openstack.awesome.our:5000/v3/auth/tokens: HTTPConnectionPool(host='openstack.awesome.our', port=5000): Max retries exceeded with url: /v3/auth/tokens (Caused by NewConnectionError('<urllib3.connection.HTTPConnection object at 0x7f54631feeb8>: Failed to establish a new connection: [Errno -2] No address found',))"
  }
}

Deployments¶

Lists, creates, cancels, shows details for, and deletes Coriolis deployments.

GET
/deployments

List Deployments

Lists all deployments.

Normal response codes: 200

Error response codes: unauthorized(401), forbidden(403)

Response¶

Name

In

Type

Description

deployments

body

array

Array of deployment objects.

id

body

uuid

The id of a coriolis deployment.

deleted

body

integer

Whether a deployment is deleted or not. 1 for deleted 0 for not deleted

deleted_at

body

object

The timestamp of deletion for a deployment.

instances

body

array

An array of all instance identifiers to be deployed.

notes

body

object

Notes about the deployment.

user_id

body

uuid

Coriolis supports multiple users, this is the respective user’s id.

destination_environment

body

object

JSON containing the options of how the instance will be configured on the destination cloud differently from the source cloud, such as network mapping.

source_environment

body

object

JSON containing the options specific to the source cloud of the instance.

type

body

string

The type of deployment, can also be a transfer.

origin_endpoint_id

body

uuid

The id of the deployment source cloud endpoint.

created_at

body

string

Timestamp of deployment creation.

updated_at

body

string

Timestamp of last deployment update.

project_id

body

uuid

Coriolis supports multiple projects, this is the respective project’s id.

transfer_id

body

uuid

The id of the transfer.

base_id

body

string

The id of the deployment in the mariadb database.

destination_endpoint_id

body

uuid

The id of the deployment destination cloud endpoint.

network_map

body

object

Object containing the network mapping.

storage_mappings

body

object

Object containing storage backend mapping.

last_execution_status

body

string

Last execution status of the current deployment.

origin_minion_pool_id

body

string

Pre-existing minion pool ID on the source platform.

destination_minion_pool_id

body

string

Pre-existing minion pool ID on the destination platform.

instance_osmorphing_minion_pool_mappings

body

object

Mapping between deployed instance name and their respective morphing minion pool IDs.

user_scripts (Optional)

body

object

Mapping between instances selected for deployment and custom scripts to be run during OSMorphing stage.

transfer_id

body

uuid

The id of the transfer.

transfer_scenario_type

body

string

The type of transfer scenario.

shutdown_instances

body

boolean

A boolean which describes whether the execution to shutdown the source instance for the deployment process.

GET
/deployments/{deployment_id}

Show Deployment

Shows details about a deployment.

Preconditions

The deployment must exist.

Normal response codes: 200

Error response codes: unauthorized(401), forbidden(403)

Request¶

Name

In

Type

Description

deployment_id

path

uuid

The id of the deployment

Response¶

Name

In

Type

Description

deployment

body

object

Object containing deployment details.

id

body

uuid

The id of a coriolis deployment.

deleted

body

integer

Whether a deployment is deleted or not. 1 for deleted 0 for not deleted

deleted_at

body

object

The timestamp of deletion for a deployment.

instances

body

array

An array of all instance identifiers to be deployed.

notes

body

object

Notes about the deployment.

tasks

body

array

The array of tasks that the deployment is going through, contains id,instance name, status, and other details about each task.

user_id

body

uuid

Coriolis supports multiple users, this is the respective user’s id.

destination_environment

body

object

JSON containing the options of how the instance will be configured on the destination cloud differently from the source cloud, such as network mapping.

source_environment

body

object

JSON containing the options specific to the source cloud of the instance.

type

body

string

The type of deployment, can also be a transfer.

origin_endpoint_id

body

uuid

The id of the deployment source cloud endpoint.

created_at

body

string

Timestamp of deployment creation.

updated_at

body

string

Timestamp of last deployment update.

project_id

body

uuid

Coriolis supports multiple projects, this is the respective project’s id.

transfer_id

body

uuid

The id of the transfer.

base_id

body

string

The id of the deployment in the mariadb database.

destination_endpoint_id

body

uuid

The id of the deployment destination cloud endpoint.

network_map

body

object

Object containing the network mapping.

storage_mappings

body

object

Object containing storage backend mapping.

last_execution_status

body

string

Last execution status of the current deployment.

origin_minion_pool_id

body

string

Pre-existing minion pool ID on the source platform.

destination_minion_pool_id

body

string

Pre-existing minion pool ID on the destination platform.

instance_osmorphing_minion_pool_mappings

body

object

Mapping between deployed instance name and their respective morphing minion pool IDs.

user_scripts (Optional)

body

object

Mapping between instances selected for deployment and custom scripts to be run during OSMorphing stage.

transfer_id

body

uuid

The id of the transfer.

transfer_scenario_type

body

string

The type of transfer scenario.

shutdown_instances

body

boolean

A boolean which describes whether the execution to shutdown the source instance for the deployment process.

POST
/deployments

Create Deployment From Transfer

Creates deployment from a successful transfer execution.

Preconditions

A transfer execution must exist.

Normal response codes: 200

Error response codes: unauthorized(401), forbidden(403), itemNotFound(404)

Request¶

Name

In

Type

Description

deployment

body

object

Object containing deployment details.

transfer_id

body

uuid

The id of the transfer.

force

body

boolean

Boolean representing whether the deployment is forced or not.

clone_disks

body

boolean

Boolean representing whether the deployment is started from transferred disks.

skip_os_morphing

body

boolean

Boolean whether to skip os morphing or not.

instance_osmorphing_minion_pool_mappings

body

object

Mapping between deployed instance name and their respective morphing minion pool IDs.
Example of Deployment Create From Transfer Request
{
  "deployment": {
    "clone_disks": true,
    "force": false,
    "transfer_id": "0460aa4d-6b16-4c98-bd56-27ee186e4a22",
    "skip_os_morphing": false,
    "instance_osmorphing_minion_pool_mappings": {
      "instance1": "morphing_pool"
    }
  }
}

Response¶

Name

In

Type

Description

deployment

body

object

Object containing deployment details.

id

body

uuid

The id of a coriolis deployment.

deleted

body

integer

Whether a deployment is deleted or not. 1 for deleted 0 for not deleted

deleted_at

body

object

The timestamp of deletion for a deployment.

instances

body

array

An array of all instance identifiers to be deployed.

notes

body

object

Notes about the deployment.

status

body

object

Notes about the deployment.

tasks

body

array

The array of tasks that the deployment is going through, contains id,instance name, status, and other details about each task.

user_id

body

uuid

Coriolis supports multiple users, this is the respective user’s id.

destination_environment

body

object

JSON containing the options of how the instance will be configured on the destination cloud differently from the source cloud, such as network mapping.

source_environtment

body

object

JSON containing the options specific to the source cloud of the instance.

type

body

string

The type of deployment, can also be a transfer.

info

body

object

Information about the instance that is deployed.

origin_endpoint_id

body

uuid

The id of the deployment source cloud endpoint.

created_at

body

string

Timestamp of deployment creation.

updated_at

body

string

Timestamp of last deployment update.

project_id

body

uuid

Coriolis supports multiple projects, this is the respective project’s id.

transfer_id

body

uuid

The id of the transfer.

base_id

body

string

The id of the deployment in the mariadb database.

destination_endpoint_id

body

uuid

The id of the deployment destination cloud endpoint.

network_map

body

object

Object containing the network mapping.

storage_mappings

body

object

Object containing storage backend mapping.

last_execution_status

body

string

Last execution status of the current deployment.

origin_minion_pool_id

body

string

Pre-existing minion pool ID on the source platform.

destination_minion_pool_id

body

string

Pre-existing minion pool ID on the destination platform.

instance_osmorphing_minion_pool_mappings

body

object

Mapping between deployed instance name and their respective morphing minion pool IDs.

shutdown_instances

body

boolean

A boolean which describes whether the execution to shutdown the source instance for the deployment process.

DELETE
/deployments/{deployment_id}

Delete Deployment

Deletes an non-running deployment.

Preconditions

The deployment must exist and not be running.

Normal response codes: 204

Error response codes: unauthorized(401), forbidden(403), itemNotFound(404)

Request¶

Name

In

Type

Description

deployment_id

path

uuid

The id of the deployment

Response¶

There is no response body for a successful deletion of an deployment.

POST
/deployments/{deployment_id}/actions

Cancel Deployment

Cancels a running deployment.

Preconditions

The deployment must exist and must be running.

Normal response codes: 200

Error response codes: unauthorized(401), forbidden(403), itemNotFound(404)

Request¶

Name

In

Type

Description

deployment_id

path

uuid

The id of the deployment

force

body

boolean

Boolean representing whether the deployment cancellation is forced.

cancel

body

string

Object containing information about the type of deployment cancellation.
Example of A Deployment Cancellation Request
{
  "cancel": {
    "force": false
  }
}

Response¶

There is no response to a successful deployment cancellation.

Minion Pools¶

Lists, creates, updates, shows details for and deletes minion pools. It also allocates, deallocates and refreshes information for minion machines for minion pools.

GET
/minion_pools

List Minion Pools

List details for all minion pools.

Normal response codes: 200

Error response codes: unauthorized(401), forbidden(403), itemNotFound(404)

Response¶

Name

In

Type

Description

minion_pools

body

array

The array of minion pools.

id

body

uuid

The ID of the minion pool.

name

body

string

The name of the minion pool.

notes (Optional)

body

string

Notes about the minion pool.

endpoint_id

body

uuid

The ID of the minion pool endpoint.

environment_options

body

object

The configuration for the minion machines of the minion pool.

os_type

body

string

The OS type for the minion machines of this minion pool.

maintenance_trust_id

body

uuid

Maintenance trust_id of the minion pool.

platform

body

string

The platform of the minion pool. Can either be ‘source’ or ‘destination’.

created_at

body

string

Timestamp of minion pool creation.

updated_at

body

string

Timestamp of minion pool update.

deleted_at

body

string

Timestamp of minion pool deletion.

deleted

body

string

Whether a minion pool is deleted or not. 1 for deleted 0 for not deleted

shared_resources

body

object

Mapping of shared resources and their respective IDs for the minion machines of the minion pool.

status

body

string

The status of the minion pool. Accepted values: ‘UNKNOWN’, ‘ERROR’, ‘DEALLOCATED’, ‘VALIATING_INPUTS’, ‘ALLOCATING_SHARED_RESOURCES’, ‘ALLOCATING_MACHINES’, ‘DEALLOCATING_MACHINES’, ‘DEALLOCATING_SHARED_RESOURCES’, ‘ALLOCATED’, ‘IN_MAINTENANCE’.

body

integer

Minimum number of minion machines to be allocated for the minion pool.

maximum_minions (Optional)

body

integer

Maximum number of minion machines allowed to be allocated for the minion pool.

minion_max_idle_time (Optional)

body

integer

Number of seconds for the minion machines of a minion_pool to be allowed in idle state before executing its retention strategy.

minion_retention_strategy (Optional)

body

string

The retention strategy used for the minion machines of the minion pool. Can either be ‘delete’ or ‘poweroff’.

minion_machines

body

array

Array of minion machine objects allocated in a minion_pool.

Create Minion Pool

Creates a minion pool.

Normal response codes: 200

Error response codes: unauthorized(401), forbidden(403)

In

Type

body

body

string

body

uuid

body

object

The configuration for the minion machines of the minion pool.

body

string

The OS type for the minion machines of this minion pool.

body

string

DELETE
/minion_pools/{minion_pool_id}

Delete Minion Pool

Deletes a Minion Pool.

Preconditions

The Minion Pool must exist and be in DEALLOCATED state.

Normal response codes: 204

Error response codes: unauthorized(401), forbidden(403), itemNotFound(404)

Request¶

Name

In

Type

Description

minion_pool_id

path

uuid

The ID of the minion pool.

Response¶

There is no response body for a successful deletion.

Error response codes: unauthorized(401), forbidden(403)

Transfers¶

Lists, creates, updates, shows details for, and deletes cloud transfers.

GET
/transfers

List Transfers

List all transfers.

Normal response codes: 200

Error response codes: unauthorized(401), forbidden(403), itemNotFound(404)

Response¶

Name

In

Type

Description

transfers

body

array

Array of transfer objects.

id

body

uuid

The id of the transfer.

deleted

body

integer

Value representing whether the transfer is deleted or not

deleted_at

body

string

Timestamp of transfer deletion if applicable.

executions

body

array

An empty array. Use the /transfers/{transfer_id} request to get the transfer executions.

instances

body

array

Name array of the instances to be transferred.

notes

body

string

Notes about the transfer.

user_id

body

uuid

Coriolis supports multiple users, this is the respective user’s id.

destination_environment

body

object

JSON containing the options of how the instance will be configured on the destination cloud differently from the source cloud, such as network mapping.

source_environment

body

object

JSON containing the options specific to the source cloud of the instance.

type

body

string

Type of coriolis action, in this case, a transfer.

origin_endpoint_id

body

uuid

The id of the origin cloud endpoint for the transfer action.

created_at

body

string

Timestamp of transfer creation.

updated_at

body

string

Timestamp of last transfer update.

project_id

body

uuid

Coriolis supports multiple projects, this is the respective project’s id.

base_id

body

string

The id of the deployment in the mariadb database.

destination_endpoint_id

body

uuid

The id of the destination cloud endpoint for the transfer action.

network_map

body

object

Object containing the network mapping.

storage_mappings

body

object

Object containing storage backend mapping.

last_execution_status

body

string

Last execution status of the current transfer.

origin_minion_pool_id

body

string

Pre-existing minion pool ID on the source platform.

destination_minion_pool_id

body

string

Pre-existing minion pool ID on the destination platform.

instance_osmorphing_minion_pool_mappings

body

object

Mapping between deployed instance name and their respective morphing minion pool IDs.

user_scripts (Optional)

body

object

Mapping between instances selected for deployment and custom scripts to be run during OSMorphing stage.

scenario

body

string

The type of scenario.

DELETE
/transfers/{transfer_id}

Delete Transfer

Deletes a transfer.

Preconditions

The transfer must exist and not have a running execution or deployment.

Normal response codes: 204

Error response codes: unauthorized(401), forbidden(403), itemNotFound(404)

Request¶

Name

In

Type

Description

transfer_id

path

uuid

The ID of the transfer.

Response¶

There is no response body for a successful deletion.

POST
/transfers/{transfer_id}/executions

Create Transfer Execution

Executes a transfer.

Preconditions

The transfer must exist.

Normal response codes: 200

Error response codes: unauthorized(401), forbidden(403),

Request¶

Name

In

Type

Description

shutdown_instances

body

boolean

A boolean which describes whether the execution to shutdown the source instance for the transfer process.

transfer_id

path

uuid

The ID of the transfer.

Example Transfer Execution Create Request

{
  "execution": {
    "shutdown_instances": false
  }
}

In

Type

Description

object

GET
/transfers/{transfer_id}/executions

List Transfer Executions

List a transfer’s executions.

Preconditions The transfer must exist.

Normal response codes: 200

Error response codes: unauthorized(401), forbidden(403), itemNotFound(404)

Request¶

Name

In

Type

Description

transfer_id

path

uuid

The ID of the transfer.

Response¶

Name

In

Type

Description

executions

body

array

An array of execution objects.

updated_at

body

string

Timestamp of last transfer update.

action_id

body

uuid

The id of the transfer.

deleted

body

integer

Integer representing whether the execution is deleted or not.

deleted_at

body

integer

Timestamp of deletion time, if applicable for the transfer execution.

created_at

body

integer

Timestamp of creation time of the transfer execution.

number

body

integer

Integer representing n’th execution of the transfer.

status

body

string

The status of the transfer execution, can either be RUNNING , ERROR or COMPLETED

id

body

array

The id of the transfer execution.

type

body

string

The type of the transfer execution. Can either be ‘transfer_execution’, ‘transfer_update’ or ‘transfer_disks_delete’

GET
/transfers/{transfer_id}/executions/{execution_id}

Show Transfer Execution

Show a transfer’s execution.

Preconditions The transfer execution must exist.

Normal response codes: 200

Error response codes: unauthorized(401), forbidden(403), itemNotFound(404)

Request¶

Name

In

Type

Description

transfer_id

path

uuid

The ID of the transfer.

execution_id

path

uuid

The id of the transfer execution.

Response¶

Name

In

Type

Description

execution

body

boolean

An execution object

number

body

integer

Integer representing n’th execution of the transfer.

action_id

body

uuid

The id of the transfer.

deleted

body

integer

Integer representing whether the execution is deleted or not.

deleted_at

body

integer

Timestamp of deletion time, if applicable for the transfer execution.

created_at

body

integer

Timestamp of creation time of the transfer execution.

updated_at

body

string

Timestamp of last transfer execution update.

status

body

string

The status of the transfer execution, can either be RUNNING , ERROR or COMPLETED

tasks

body

array

An array of all the tasks regarding a specific transfer execution.

action

body

array

An action object regarding the specific operation.

id

body

array

The id of the transfer execution.

type

body

string

The type of the transfer execution. Can either be ‘transfer_execution’, ‘transfer_update’ or ‘transfer_disks_delete’

Transfers Actions¶

POST
/transfers/{transfer_id}/actions

Delete Transfer Disks

Deletes a transfers disks on the destination environment.

Preconditions

The transfer execution must have at least one successful execution.

Normal response codes: 200

Error response codes: unauthorized(401), forbidden(403), itemNotFound(404)

Request¶

Name

In

Type

Description

delete_disks

body

object

An object that describes delete disk transfer action.

transfer_id

path

uuid

The ID of the transfer.

Example of Transfer Execution Cancel Request

{
  "delete-disks": null
}

Response¶

The last execution of the requested transfer is returned.

Example of Delete Transfer Disks Response

{
  "execution": {
    "created_at": "2019-07-24T21:04:16.000000",

Transfer Execution Actions¶

POST
/transfers/{transfer_id}/executions/{execution_id}/actions

Cancel Transfer Execution

Cancels an ongoing transfer execution.

Preconditions

The transfer must exist and its execution must be ongoing.

Normal response codes: 200

Error response codes: unauthorized(401), forbidden(403), itemNotFound(404)

Request¶

Name

In

Type

Description

force

body

boolean

A boolean which describes whether to force the cancellation of a transfer execution.

transfer_id

path

uuid

The ID of the transfer.

execution_id

path

uuid

The id of the transfer execution.

Example of Transfer Execution Cancel Request

{
  "cancel": {
    "force": false
  }
}

Response¶

There is no response to a successful transfers execution cancellation.

DELETE
/transfers/{transfer_id}/executions/{execution_id}

Delete Transfer Execution

Deletes an transfer execution.

Preconditions

The Transfer execution must not be running.

Normal response codes: 204

Error response codes: unauthorized(401), forbidden(403), itemNotFound(404)

Request¶

Name

In

Type

Description

transfer_id

path

uuid

The ID of the transfer.

execution_id

path

uuid

The id of the transfer execution.

Response¶

There is no response body for a successful deletion of an transfer execution.

Transfer Scheduling¶

GET
/transfers/{transfer_id}/schedules

Transfer Schedule List

List schedules for a transfer.

Normal response codes: 200

Error response codes: unauthorized(401), forbidden(403), itemNotFound(404)

Request¶

Name

In

Type

Description

transfer_id

path

uuid

The ID of the transfer.

Response¶

Name

In

Type

Description

schedules

body

array

Array of transfer schedules.

id

body

uuid

The ID of the transfer schedule.

deleted

body

string

Value representing whether the transfer schedule is deleted or not

deleted_at

body

string

Timestamp of transfer schedule deletion if applicable.

created_at

body

string

Timestamp of transfer schedule creation.

updated_at

body

string

Timestamp of last transfer schedule update.

transfer_id

body

uuid

The id of the transfer.

enabled

body

boolean

Whether the schedule is enabled or not.

shutdown_instance

body

boolean

A boolean which describes whether the execution to shutdown the source instance for the transfer process.

schedule

body

object

Object containing the schedule information(month, day of month, etc.).

minute (Optional)

body

integer

The minute of the hour at which to run.

hour (Optional)

body

integer

The hour of the day at which to run.

dom (Optional)

body

integer

The day of the month at which to run.

month (Optional)

body

integer

The month in which to run.

dow (Optional)

body

integer

The day of week in which to run.

expiration_date

body

string

ISO8601 formatted date which sets the transfer schedule expiration date.

boolean

A boolean which describes whether the execution to shutdown the source instance for the transfer process.

schedule

body

object

Object containing the schedule information(month, day of month, etc.).

minute (Optional)

body

integer

The minute of the hour at which to run.

hour (Optional)

body

integer

The hour of the day at which to run.

dom (Optional)

body

integer

The day of the month at which to run.

month (Optional)

body

integer

The month in which to run.

dow (Optional)

body

integer

The day of week in which to run.

expiration_date

body

string

ISO8601 formatted date which sets the transfer schedule expiration date.

Example of Transfer Schedule Update Response

{
  "schedule": {
    "created_at": "2019-07-23T17:28:35.000000",
    "updated_at": "2019-07-23T17:39:24.000000",
    "deleted_at": null,
    "deleted": "0",
    "id": "20f17188-8053-4e10-bf1b-f60c1d3b8022",
    "transfer_id": "0460aa4d-6b16-4c98-bd56-27ee186e4a22",
    "schedule": {
      "dow": 0,
      "minute": 30,
      "hour": 20
    },
    "expiration_date": null,
    "enabled": true,
    "shutdown_instance": true,
    "trust_id": "16120b7803864466bc445d8d43af1980"
  }
}
DELETE
/transfers/{transfer_id}/schedules/{schedule_id}

Transfer Schedule Delete

Deletes a transfer schedule.

Preconditions The transfer schedule must exist.

Normal response codes: 204

Error response codes: unauthorized(401), forbidden(403)

Request¶

Name

In

Type

Description

transfer_id

path

uuid

The ID of the transfer.

schedule_id

body

uuid

The ID of the transfer schedule.

Response¶

There is no response body for a successful deletion of a transfer schedule.

Services¶

Lists, creates, updates, shows details for, and deletes services.

/services

/services

Create Service

Creates a service.

Normal response codes: 200

Error response codes: unauthorized(401), forbidden(403)

Name

In

Type

Description

object

binary

body

string

topic

body

string

enabled

body

boolean

Boolean representing whether the service is enabled or not.

mapped_regions (Optional)

body

array

Array of regions mapped to this service.

Example of Service Create Request

{
    "service": {
        "host": "coriolis-worker-ONbgH1NV",
        "binary": "coriolis-worker-test",
        "topic": "coriolis_worker-test",
        "mapped_regions": [
            "5e31066c-3512-4e8d-9e68-0a5de3d35c5f"

PUT
/services/{service_id}

Update service

Updates the already existing service, modifying the mapped regions or availability.

Preconditions

The service must exist.

Normal Response Codes: 200

Error response codes: unauthorized(401), forbidden(403), itemNotFound(404)

Name

In

Type

Description

service_id

path

The ID of the service.

object

array

body

boolean

Boolean representing whether the service is enabled or not.

    "service": {
        "enabled": true,
        "mapped_regions": [
            "5e31066c-3512-4e8d-9e68-0a5de3d35c5f"

Preconditions

Normal response codes: 204

Error response codes: itemNotFound(404),unauthorized(401), forbidden(403)

Request¶

Name

In

Type

Description

service_id

path

uuid

The ID of the service.

Response¶

There is no response body for a successful deletion of a service.
